Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or data to support the statement that whoever wins Pennsylvania will be the next President. It simply references a report from FiveThirtyEight without providing any specific information or analysis.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the winner of Pennsylvania will automatically win the election, without considering other factors such as the electoral college system or the outcomes of other battleground states.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of Pennsylvania in determining the outcome of the election. While Pennsylvania is an important battleground state, it is not the sole determinant of who will become the next President.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Contradict fact: There is no evidence of contradictory facts in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying solely on the report from FiveThirtyEight without providing additional analysis or context.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that could influence the outcome of the election.
